alert.note: Alert for Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 4:55PM EDT until July 04 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding may be ongoing in some spots. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, Garden City, Murrells Inlet and Grand Strand Regional Medical Center. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause dangerous flooding, especially near creeks and streams, drainage ditches, and low-lying flood prone areas. Turn around, don`t drown if you encounter a flooded road. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away from storm drains, culverts, creeks, and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep you away.
